reporting-org.narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre

title.narrative: Immediate response to the urgent humanitarian needs included in the Humanitarian Response Plan 2021 and the (IPC) report to prevent famine in Yemen

description.narrative: Providing 60,000 tons of wheat flour and 7,600 tons of vegetable oil to complete the missing items in the general food assistance program Distribution of food in the form of in-kind rations or vouchers.

This contribution will only be used to provide the missing food items in the food basket, namely wheat and vegetable oil, in the areas specified in the work plan. The United Nations World Food Program will target 4.29 million severely food insecure people in 15 governorates to meet the urgent food needs of the most vulnerable in Yemen in 2021, as documented in the latest integrated report. Food Security Phase Classification (IPC). The United Nations World Food Program will target 4.9 million severely food insecure people in 15 governorates to meet the urgent food needs of the most vulnerable in Yemen in 2021, as documented in the latest integrated report. Food Security Phase Classification (IPC).

participating-org.narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
